example[0]: Jo’s forging ahead with her plans to write a film script.
definition[1]: to increase quickly and by a large amount
example[1]: The dollar forged ahead to a 16-month high against the euro.
definition[2]: to move forward with a plan or course of action
example[2]: Petro-Canada, Canada’s state-owned oil and gas company, is forging ahead with plans to sell as much as 15% of its shares to the public.
definition[3]: to become bigger and more successful
example[3]: Company officials said the company is ready to forge ahead in Europe.
